title: HELP. engraving type
content:
hey ppls. just found this site. working on a school project, and we’re doing a proposal for a monument in downtown halifax. A memorial piece for fallen peace officers. 17 names have to go on our structure, and am wondering about the history of type. What would be an appropriate typeface to be engraved? cartier book? trajan? not sure about the application as well. thoughts? much appreciated.

k

 [‹ Calling all Detroit Typophiles](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38609 "Go to previous forum topic") [How's my kerning? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38543 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kmaasik

comments.content: Look up memorial markers in your yellow pages, and you will find the companies that do this kind of work. Visit and find out what faces they have and recommend. It will be the best kind of research you can do.
